persistence.fetchGlobalVisibilityErrorTitle: Failed to fetch app visibility settings
persistence.fetchGlobalVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong. Please reload the page. If this occurs frequently, please contact us.
persistence.saveGlobalVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.
persistence.fetchProjectVisibilitiesErrorTitle: Failed to fetch project visibility settings
persistence.fetchProjectVisibilitiesErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong. Please reload the page. If this occurs frequently, please contact us.
persistence.addProjectVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.
persistence.changeProjectVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.
persistence.removeProjectVisibilityErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to reset the visibility for this project to default. Reload the page and try again.

visibilityOverviewScreen.heading: Activate features
visibilityOverviewScreen.headingDescription: Choose which features of Microsoft 365 for Jira should be active.
visibilityOverviewScreen.disabledTooltip: This feature is only available in our app 'Microsoft 365 for Jira'
visibilityOverviewScreen.projectVisibilityToggleDisabledTooltip: Changing this setting is only possible in Microsoft 365 for Jira.
visibilityOverviewScreen.projectsDescription: Choose which features should be active or disabled in the specific project.
visibilityOverviewScreen.globalDescription: Enable features across all projects. Specific projects can be customized below.

productDescription.teams-cloud: Bring your Microsoft Teams conversations and chats to your Jira issues and vice versa.
productDescription.email-cloud: Create and update issues from your Outlook inbox. Connect emails to Jira issues and send emails from Jira.
productDescription.meetings-cloud: Schedule Microsoft Teams and Outlook meetings in Jira. See availabilities and send meeting requests from Jira.
productDescription.todo-cloud: Create and see personal To Dos in your Jira issues or sync all your Jira issues automatically.
productDescription.calendar-cloud: Add a configurable Outlook calendar to display Outlook and Jira events in Jira projects.
productDescription.teams-server: Bring your Microsoft Teams conversations and chats to your Jira issues and vice versa.
productDescription.email-server: Create and update issues from your Outlook inbox, using the powerful Outlook add-in.
productDescription.meetings-server: Schedule Microsoft Teams and Outlook meetings in Jira. See availabilities and send meeting requests from Jira.
productDescription.calendar-server: Add a configurable Outlook calendar to display Outlook and Jira events in Jira projects.

disableProductDescription.teams: You’re about to disable the Microsoft Teams feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.email: You’re about to disable the email feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.meetings: You’re about to disable the meetings feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.todo: You’re about to disable the Microsoft To Do feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
disableProductDescription.calendar: You’re about to disable the calendar feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.

enableProductDescription.teams: You’re about to enable the Microsoft Teams feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.email: You’re about to enable the email feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.meetings: You’re about to enable the meetings feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.todo: You’re about to enable the Microsoft To Do feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.
enableProductDescription.calendar: You’re about to enable the calendar feature for all projects by default. Project-specific settings won’t be affected by this choice.

wizard.headline: Manage visibility
wizard.intro: Grant the visibility to the right projects, so that everybody can do their job in the best way.

help.documentationText: Find common questions, an installation guide or a feature overview in our support portal.
help.contactUsText: You need technical help or want a personal demo? Get in touch with us.
help.supportToolsText: Additional configurations, please only use in consultation with the support team.

gettingStarted.intro3: Connect Jira with your Microsoft 365 tools for seamless teamwork. Enable the functionality you need below.
gettingStarted.teamsInfo: Connect your Microsoft Teams conversations and chat to your Jira issues. Using Jira Service Management? Let customers create support tickets in Microsoft Teams.
gettingStarted.emailInfo: Create and update issues from your Outlook inbox and put emails in a Jira context. See whole email conversations in Jira and share, read or send emails right away.
gettingStarted.meetingsInfo: Schedule Microsoft Teams and Outlook meetings in your Jira issue: See availabilities of relevant users and send meeting requests directly in Jira.
gettingStarted.calendarInfo: Add a configurable Outlook calendar to display Outlook and Jira events in Jira projects.
gettingStarted.inValidLicenseText: You don't have a valid license or it has expired. If you'd like to continue using our app, please get a valid license!
gettingStarted.todoInfo: Sync all your Jira issues automatically with your chosen Microsoft To Do list and get a holistic overview of all your task.
gettingStarted.supportPortalText: You have a question? Or need help? We're happy to assist you.
gettingStarted.securityText: We ensure the highest security standard for your data.

adminConnectivityScreen.heading: Connection setup
adminConnectivityScreen.description: For the app to work properly, it requires a connection from and to yasoon cloud services. This page checks the connection status and helps troubleshooting issues.
adminConnectivityScreen.statusOperationalDescription: App is fully operational. Your system is connected to the yasoon cloud services.
adminConnectivityScreen.statusInterruptedDescription: The connection to the yasoon cloud services is interrupted and many feature won't work correctly. If you have copied the system, please make sure the url below is correct. Otherwise, please check your firewall or reverse proxy configuration.
adminConnectivityScreen.statusErrorDescription: A connection to the yasoon cloud services is required and many feature won't work correctly if the connection is not setup correctly.  Please check your firewall or reverse proxy configuration and make sure a connection to and from the yasoon cloud services is possible.
adminConnectivityScreen.editConnectionHelpDescription: The system requires a public url that is reachable by yasoon cloud services. If your system is behind a firewall, you need to allow access for all of the following IPs.
adminConnectivityScreen.connectionUpdateModalDescription: Resetting the connection for the instance will result in data loss and should generally not be done in a production environment. Please reach out to our support if you are unsure (contact@yasoon.com).
adminConnectivityScreen.connectionUpdateModalCheckboxLabel: I understand this action will reset the instance and the instance will loose access to:
adminConnectivityScreen.webhookTeamsSuccess: Webhook for the Microsoft Teams feature is active.
adminConnectivityScreen.webhookTeamsSuccessSecondary: The webhook is necessary for certain updates posted into Microsoft Teams. It is currently configured correctly and active.
adminConnectivityScreen.webhookTeamsWarning: Webhook for the Microsoft Teams feature is disabled.
adminConnectivityScreen.webhookTeamsWarningSecondary: Webhook has been disabled manually and some Microsoft Teams features might not work as expected. Go to System --> Webhooks to reenable.
adminConnectivityScreen.webhookTeamsError: Webhook for the Microsoft Teams feature is not configured.
adminConnectivityScreen.webhookTeamsErrorSecondary: The webhook could not be created automatically and some Microsoft Teams features might not work as expected. Make sure that your Jira instance has received a System Id. Afterwards the webhook should be created automatically.

secretRotation.heading: Secret rotation
secretRotation.description: The app stores a shared secret to ensure a secure connection with our services. All Jira admins may have access to this secret. To avoid any malicious and unauthorized data access, we recommend rotating the secret whenever you remove an admin from your instance

connectivityCheck.connectivityCheckDescription: Support tool to check and troubleshoot the connection to mandatory services. Only for analysis purposes, this won’t change any configuration.

projectActivateFeaturesScreen.heading: Activate features
projectActivateFeaturesScreen.headingDescription: Choose which features of Microsoft 365 for Jira should be active in this project.
projectActivateFeaturesScreen.noProjectAdminEmptyState: You need project admin permissions to view this page.

adminSupportScreen.description: This are support features, please only use in consultation with the support team.
adminSupportScreen.loadPropertyFailedMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to load. Reload the page and try again.
adminSupportScreen.savePropertyFailedMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to save. Reload the page and try again.

gettingStartedScreen.heading: Connect Jira automation with Microsoft 365
gettingStartedScreen.overviewDescription: Automation within Microsoft 365 for Jira is a no-code capability and is based on Jira automation.

triggers.heading: Microsoft 365 trigger
triggers.description: Triggers let you execute a Jira Automation, when events happen in our Microsoft 365 app. For example, you can start an automation when a new chat is started or a new email is sent from an issue. Use the "Incoming webhook" trigger in Jira automations and insert the Jira webhook URL for creating a Microsoft 365 trigger.

actions.heading: Microsoft 365 action
actions.description: Actions allow you to automate tasks in Microsoft 365, such as creating a backup of a linked Microsoft Teams chats or posting a notification to a Teams channel. Actions can be used like inbuilt Jira Automation actions, but are configured by using the "Send web request" action. You'll receive the necessary URL after creating the Microsoft 365 action.

gettingStartedScreen.exploreDescription: There are plenty ways to use automation. It’s a very versatile concept that can fit to many indiviual workflows. Explore some ideas how automation can enhance your processes in the support portal.

actionScreen.description: Actions allow you to run tasks in Microsoft 365. We provide you with a URL that you can use with the 'Send web request' action in Jira Automation.
actionScreen.deleteActionWarning: Please make sure this action is not used in any Jira automation, as these will not work anymore.
actionScreen.emptyStateHeading: You haven't configured any actions yet

triggerScreen.description: Triggers kick off the execution of your automation rules by calling the 'Incoming webhook' trigger in Jira Automation.
triggerScreen.emptyStateHeading: You haven't configured any triggers yet

action.heading: Create action
action.create-chatDescription: Send a message in a Teams chat and include the participants of your choice.
action.reply-chatsDescription: Reply to all Teams chats linked to the issue, that have the bot installed.
action.create-conversationDescription: Post a message in a Teams channel of your choice.
action.reply-conversationsDescription: Add a comment to all Teams conversations linked to the issue.
action.reply-conversationDescription: Add a comment to a specific Teams conversation.
action.create-teams-backupDescription: Add a backup file for each chat and channel conversation to the Jira issue.
action.create-meetingDescription: Send a meeting to the participants of your choice.
action.send-bot-messageDescription: Send a bot message to a user, who has installed the bot.
action.send-emailDescription: Send an email to the recipients of your choice.

trigger.heading: Create trigger
trigger.chat-createdDescription: Fired when a chat was created in an issue.
trigger.conversation-createdDescription: Fired when a conversation was created in an issue.
trigger.teams-backup-createdDescription: Fired when a backup of Teams chat or channel conversations was created.
trigger.meeting-createdDescription: Fired when a meeting was created in an issue.
trigger.teams-channel-regexDescription: Fired when the Teams bot receives a message with the configured keyword in a channel.
trigger.teams-personal-regexDescription: Fired when the Teams bot receives a personal message with the configured keyword.
trigger.email-sentDescription: Fired when an email was sent in an issue.

createChatScreen.heading: Create Teams chat
createChatScreen.description: Please provide the details for the new chat. It will be automatically linked to the issue from the Automation rule.
createChatScreen.chatCreatorDescription: For security reasons, you can currently only select and authorize a single user as chat creator. This user will also be part of the chat. We recommend you to create a service user until we support dynamic user selection.

replyTeamsChatScreen.heading: Reply Teams chat
replyTeamsChatScreen.description: Please provide the details for the chat reply. Our documentation will help you to choose the correct settings.
replyTeamsChatScreen.noPortalNotificationsDescription: To post replies into a chat, please enable notifications in the customer portal settings.
replyTeamsChatScreen.comingSoon: Specific chat replies coming soon. Currently all customer chats with notifications enabled will be replied to.

backupTeamsMessagesScreen.heading: Create Teams backup
backupTeamsMessagesScreen.description: Currently it is only supported to backup Teams chats, conversation support will follow soon.
backupTeamsMessagesScreen.addKeywordComment: Add a comment with keywords to the Jira issue
backupTeamsMessagesScreen.addKeywordCommentInfo: This allows you to search for the chat backup in Jira using the native search.

createConversationScreen.heading: Create Teams conversation
createConversationScreen.description: Please provide the details for the new channel conversation. It will be posted by the selected bot and, if provided, linked to the issue from the Automation rule.
createConversationScreen.channelChooserTooltip: Please select the desired Teams channel. Note that only Teams channels can be selected, in which the selected bot is installed.

replyTeamsConversationScreen.heading: Reply Teams conversation
replyTeamsConversationScreen.description: Please provide the details for the conversation reply. Our documentation will help you to choose the correct settings.
replyTeamsConversationScreen.requiresCustomWebbhookData: Please choose custom data for the web request body, if you want to reply to a single conversation.
replyTeamsConversationScreen.conversationTypeSelectionDisabledTooltip: The conversation type can only be changed when creating an action.

createSendBotMessageScreen.heading: Send bot message
createSendBotMessageScreen.description: Please provide the details for bot message. Please note that the users need to have the bot installed.

sendEmailScreen.heading: Send email
sendEmailScreen.description: Please provide the details for the email. Our documentation will help you to choose the correct settings.
sendEmailScreen.fromDescription: The sender of the email, please make sure that the sender is verified in your Microsoft 365 tenant. For security reasons, you can currently only select and authorize a single user as the sender of the mail.
sendEmailScreen.triggerTooltip: Choose who should be able to see this conversation
sendEmailScreen.disabledTriggerTooltip: You can't share this mail to an issue, when the action is not running in an issue context.
sendEmailScreen.sendInWorkHoursDescription: When enabled, the email will be sent only during working hours. If the action runs outside working hours, the email will be scheduled on the next working day.

workingHours.timeZoneText: The time zone for your working hours is {{timeZone}}.

mailSharingChooser.privateDescription: Only I can see this conversation
mailSharingChooser.azureTenantDescription: Every user in my organization can see this conversation
mailSharingChooser.atlassianCloudDescription: Every user with access to this issue can see this conversation
mailSharingChooser.sectionTitle: Choose who should be able to see this conversation

createOutlookEventScreen.heading: Create Outlook meeting
createOutlookEventScreen.fromDescription: The Organizer of the meeting. Please make sure that the user is verified in your Microsoft 365 tenant.
createOutlookEventScreen.noAvailabilityFor7Days: Not available for the next 7 days.

chatAccess.chooseChatPermissions: Choose who should have access to this chat in Jira
chatAccess.onlyMembersChat: Only members of the chat can view it in Jira
chatAccess.contextChatAccess: Users with issue access can view the chat.
chatAccess.contextChatAllowJoining: Users with issue access can view and join the chat.

channelSelect.noChannelSelectOptions: No channels found. You can only find channels which have 'Smart Connect for Jira' installed.
channelSelect.privateChannelNotSupported: Private channels are not supported currently
channelSelect.appNotInstalledInTeam: The app is not installed in this team yet.

officeLoginScreen.heading: Welcome to Microsoft 365 automations
officeLoginScreen.description: Please log in with your Microsoft 365 account to get started!

officeLoginMSALScreen.heading: Re-authenticate
officeLoginMSALScreen.subHeading: Your browser has restrictive privacy settings, so you need to re-authenticate every 24 hours.

userPicker.preferGuestUsersExplainer: In case there is a guest user for a selected email, prefer that user over trying to add an external user.

actionSuccess.descriptionAuthRequired1: The action with the name {{name}} has been created successfully.
actionSuccess.descriptionAuthRequired2: Please note that the action needs to be authorized by the desired Microsoft user (this might be the administrator).
actionSuccess.descriptionAuthRequired3: Use the following “Send web request” URL in Jira Automation
actionSuccess.error: Something went wrong, please try again.

actorLogin.generalDescription: The Jira user {{user}} ({{email}}) wants to get access to Microsoft 365 to create the following automation:
actorLogin.inBehalfOf: To act on behalf of the Microsoft 365 user {{user}}, he needs the following Microsoft Graph permissions:
actorLogin.noToken: The url contains no or an invalid token. Please restart the login and make sure you copy the whole url if you forward it.
actorLogin.expiredToken: The token has expired, please restart the login.
actorLogin.authorizationSuccessful: Authorization successful, you can close this window.

multipleRundSettings.label: Check to allow the automation action to only run once per issue. This is useful to prevent multiple actions from running on the same issue.

actions.issueDueDateDescription: Adds the Jira issue due date

userSettingsScreen.msalMissingFlagTitle: Microsoft login failed partially. Please re-authenticate.
userSettingsScreen.fetchConnectionsFlagErrorMessage: Something has gone wrong while trying to load the connections. Reload the page and try again.
userSettingsScreen.noAppsEnabled: You are not logged in yet.
userSettingsScreen.densityHelpText: Choose the density of your Teams layout. You can choose between comfy and compact.

sectionMessage.accountMismatchMessage: You are connected to different Jira account from Teams
sectionMessage.instanceMismatchMessage: You are connected to different Jira instance from Teams
sectionMessage.missingConnectionMessage: You are not connected to a Jira account from Teams. Please switch to Teams to establish the missing connection.

chatCreatedConfigScreen.heading: Teams chat created
chatCreatedConfigScreen.description: Please choose if the trigger should only execute for chats created in specified projects or globally.

meetingCreatedConfigScreen.heading: Outlook meeting created
meetingCreatedConfigScreen.description: Please choose if the trigger should only execute for chats created in specified projects or globally.

conversationCreatedTriggerScreen.heading: Teams conversation created
conversationCreatedTriggerScreen.description: Please choose if the trigger should only execute for channel conversation created in specified projects or globally.

emailSentConfigScreen.heading: Email sent
emailSentConfigScreen.description: Please choose if the trigger should only execute for emails sent in specified projects or globally.

channelRegexConfigScreen.heading: Teams channel message received
channelRegexConfigScreen.description: Please choose for what kind of messages the trigger should execute.
channelRegexConfigScreen.additionalSectionMessage: The selected message type might not provide issues in the webhook body.
channelRegexConfigScreen.regexFieldTooltip: We use regular expressions to find a matching message in the Teams channel.
channelRegexConfigScreen.regexHelpButtonTooltip: You can test your regular expression by clicking the 'Play' button.

personalRegexConfigScreen.heading: Personal Teams bot message received
personalRegexConfigScreen.description: Please choose for what message pattern the trigger should execute.
personalRegexConfigScreen.regexFieldTooltip: We use regular expressions to find a matching message in Teams.
personalRegexConfigScreen.regexHelpButtonTooltip: You can test your regular expression by clicking the 'Play' button.

incomingWebhookConfigScreen.description: Please configure a “Incoming webhook” trigger in Jira automation, matching the configuration below.
incomingWebhookConfigScreen.heading: Incoming webhook
incomingWebhookConfigScreen.urlFieldPlaceholder: Insert the url provided by the “Incoming webhook” trigger.
incomingWebhookConfigScreen.jiraProvidedOption: Issues provided in the webhook HTTP POST body
incomingWebhookConfigScreen.jiraJQLOption: Issues provided by running the following JQL search
incomingWebhookConfigScreen.automationLinkButtonTooltip: Go to Jira Automations to and create a automation rule with a “Incoming webhook” trigger
incomingWebhookConfigScreen.webhookDataConfigTooltip: Please configure “Incoming webhook” trigger in Jira as shown here.

channelMessageTypes.allDescription: Trigger on all messages posted in a Teams channel
channelMessageTypes.topLevelOnlyDescription: Trigger when a new channel message (top-level) is posted in Teams.
channelMessageTypes.linkedReplyOnlyDescription: Trigger when a response is posted to a conversation linked to an issue.
channelMessageTypes.replyOnlyDescription: Trigger on all replies to conversations

templateOverviewScreen.description:
Create and edit templates for Microsoft 365 (Email, Meetings, Teams).
Active templates may then be selected and used to prefill the corresponding fields.
templateOverviewScreen.missingPermission: You don't have the permissions to view this site.

templateTab.deleteSuccessMessage: The template has been deleted successfully.
templateTab.deleteTemplateWarning: This will delete the template permanently. Are you sure you want to delete this template?
templateTab.creator: Creator
templateTab.defaultTemplateTooltip: If a default template is configured, it will be loaded automatically without the user having to select it manually. The user will still be able to select a different template afterwards.
templateTab.defaultEmailReplyTooltip: If a default reply template is configured, it will be loaded automatically without the user having to select it manually. The user will still be able to select a different template afterwards.
templateTab.activeDefaultTooltip: This template is currently being used as default. Deactivating it will also remove it as default.
templateTab.systemTemplateTooltip: System templates can be used as default but will not be available for manual selection by a user.
templateTab.changedDefaultWarningMessage: Your current default is no longer active and has been de-selected.
templateTab.emptyStateBundleDescription: This feature is part of Microsoft 365 for Jira. You can switch to Microsoft 365 for Jira without losing any of your app data.
templateTab.emptyStateProjectTemplatesHeader: You haven't configured any project templates yet.

templateSingle.loginDescription: Please log in with your Microsoft 365 account to get a preview!
templateSingle.createSuccessMessage: The template has been created successfully.
templateSingle.updateSuccessMessage: The template has been saved successfully.
templateSingle.createIntroductionEmail:
Create a new email template that can be used when sending an email from Jira.
If you want to make the template available right away, select "Save & publish", otherwise choose "Save as draft" to activate it at a later point in time.
templateSingle.createIntroductionMeetings:
Create a new meeting template that can be used when creating a Outlook meeting from Jira.
If you want to make the template available right away, select "Save & publish", otherwise choose "Save as draft" to activate it at a later point in time.
templateSingle.createIntroductionChat:
Create a new chat that can be used when starting a new Teams chat from Jira.
If you want to make the template available right away, select "Save & publish", otherwise choose "Save as draft" to activate it at a later point in time.
templateSingle.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter a descriptive text for this template
templateSingle.subjectTooltip: Handlebar syntax can be used, e.g. {{issue.key}}
templateSingle.titleTooltip: Handlebar syntax can be used, e.g. {{issue.key}}
templateSingle.emailSubjectTooltip: Handlebar syntax can be used, e.g. {{issue.key}}
templateSingle.meetingsTitleTooltip: Handlebar syntax can be used, e.g. {{issue.key}}
templateSingle.chatTitleTooltip: Handlebar syntax can be used, e.g. {{issue.key}}
templateSingle.invalidFormTooltip: Please fill out the required fields.
templateSingle.inactiveTooltip: Inactive templates will not be available for selection.
templateSingle.templateContentDescription:
The template content will be rendered within the context of the current issue.
You can preview the template by selecting an issue.
templateSingle.renderErrorMessage: The template contains a syntax error and could not be rendered. Please check the template and try again.
templateSingle.noIssueSelectedTooltip: Please select an issue first to preview the template.

actions.browseUrlDescription: Adds a URL to the issue

defaultTemplatePicker.inheritedTooltip: The default template is inherited from global default template settings and must not be removed.
defaultTemplatePicker.templateNotFound: The template could not be found
defaultTemplatePicker.templateNotFoundDescription: Please remove the selected template or select another one.

email.detailDescription: Default template for emails. It will fill the subject with an issue's summary.

meetings.detailDescription: Default template for meetings. It will fill the title with an issue's key and summary. The body will contain a link to the issue.

chat.detailDescription: Default template for chats. It will fill the title with an issue's key and summary. The body will contain a link to the issue.

webhookConfigScreen.channelRelpyCustomDataText: Please provide details the channel message you wan't to reply to in the following format
webhookConfigScreen.customDataText: Please provide details to the Jira issue in the following format. You can choose between a single issue (issueId) or mutliple issues (issueIds).
webhookConfigScreen.specificReplyExample: To get the required message details, use one of the following yasoon triggers: 'Teams conversation created' or 'Teams channel message received'. And access the data using the following syntax:
